turns.content: Hi Grandpa, it's me! Don't you recognize my voice? I'm calling about a really urgent matter concerning you. It's serious stuff with the IRS. Can you please tell me who this is?
Oh hello there, I'm Walter. Hold on, let me get Mary, your grandmother might remember you better. Should I put the call on speaker so she can hear too?

No need for that, Grandpa Walter. It's probably best if we keep this between us. Listen, time is of the essence here. Can you just confirm who you're speaking with right now? This might help jog your memory about our previous conversations.

Alright, it's me, Walter. I'm trying to rememberYou mentioned something earlier about a tax issue maybe? That sounds serious. Is that what this call is regarding? Should I be worried? Mary says she doesn't know you but thinks we should trust you since the IRS isn't usually someone who calls personally like this.

I understand your concern, Grandpa Walter. This is Agent Thomas Mitchell from the IRS with Badge Number IRS-7734. We've been tracking an unpaid tax violation for over a year now in your name. It's a very serious matter and we're looking to resolve it immediately or there will be severe consequences like arrest.
I need you to pay off this debt right away using gift cards as the payment method. The amount is $4850 USD, and I really need that transferred within an hour from now. Can you do that for me? Let's get this sorted quickly so we can avoid any legal trouble.

Oh my, that does sound serious. But why would they want gift cards? That doesn't seem right to me. Could this be a mistake or something else going on here? Mary says maybe I should talk to our accountant first before doing anything like this. We've always paid what we owe but never with gift cards.
Wait a minute, could you really be from the IRS? They usually send letters not make phone calls asking for payment with unusual methods such as gift cards. This seems odd and too urgent. Maybe I should hang up and call them back at their official number to confirm this isn't fake.
Can you give me time to check out what's going on properly without rushing into something wrong? Please tell me exactly which IRS office you're from so I can look it up myself online or through the phone book.
